Rule.Name: A - Form of information
Rule.Description:
Use this table for organising reference material in libraries, and also, when using combined codes, for denoting the medium in which information is published.
'Apply' creates a Classification Reference for selected IFC entity, using Uniclass-required attributes derived from the item that you choose in the following list.

DataEntry.title: Control of substances hazardous to health (COSHH) documents

Rule.Name: B - Subject disciplines
Rule.Description:
Use this table for organising information according to subject discipline.
'Apply' creates a Classification Reference for selected IFC entity, using Uniclass-required attributes derived from the item that you choose in the following list.

DataEntry.title: History of architecture, periods and styles of architecture
Architectural design (excluding structural design), spatial design
National, EU, etc. practice and procedure

Rule.Name: C - Management
Rule.Description:
Classifies management and project management as subject disciplines. The project management section is intended also for classifying project information according to the stage in the lifecycle of a project in which the information is generated.
'Apply' creates a Classification Reference for selected IFC entity, using Uniclass-required attributes derived from the item that you choose in the following list.

DataEntry.title: National organisations operating in countries other than the UK
Geographic information system (GIS) engineers and land surveyors
Control of office documents, collating, filing
Grants, loans, discount schemes to employees

Rule.Name: D - Facilities
Rule.Description:
Classifies construction works according to the user activity (or purpose) which they are intended to serve. Each code can equally well be used for classifying a complex, a construction entity or a space.
'Apply' creates a Classification Reference for selected IFC entity, using Uniclass-required attributes derived from the item that you choose in the following list.

DataEntry.title: Suburban heavy railways, secondary lines, branch lines
Underground railways, light rail transit systems
Light rail transit running on existing British Rail tracks
Light rail transit running on special tracks
Light rail transit/trams running largely on-street
Other railways, cable transport, guided vehicle systems
Other embarkation facilities for rail transport
By-passes, loop roads, ring roads, radial roads
Access roads, drives, approach roads, culs-de-sac
Single and dual carriageway roads, grade separated roads
Road vehicle service, storage and repair facilities
Petrol stations without major shops/catering facilities
Major service stations with major shops/catering facilities
Traffic calming constructions, road vehicle control facilities
Ship sheltering and berthing facilities, harbours, docks
International airports, airports for large airliners
Landing strips, small aerodromes for light aircraft
Other obstruction-free areas over which aircraft can move
Hangars for repair and storage of aircraft
Piers and loading bridges linking terminal buildings to aircraft
Other parts of embarkation facilities, terminals
Pumping systems for pumped storage stations
Electricity generation from wave, solar, wind power
Combined heat and power generating stations
Direct supply of heat from geothermal sources
Direct supply of heat from the sun
Oil rigs, extraction from beneath ocean floor
Synthetic gas (from coal etc.) production and supply facilities
Other power supply, mineral supply facilities
Water supply treatment facilities, water works
Collection from other particular types of facilities
Package plant and other small scale plant
Nuclear fission waste products disposal facilities

Storage with little or no wall, Dutch barns
Manure storage facilities, dungsteads, farm effluent tanks, slurry tanks
Manufacturing facilities by type of industry
Other food, drink and tobacco industries
Other manufacturing, production facilities by type of industry
Manufacturing facilities by type of premises
Light industrial facilities, business parks for light industry
Regional and local legislative and administrative facilities
Benefit offices/Department of Social Security offices
Business parks consisting of office buildings
Open-plan office facilities, landscaped office facilities, bürolanschaft
Wholesaling, auction and market facilities, etc.
Retail facilities by type of goods sold
Army facilities, general armed forces facilities
Camps, depots, bases, ranges, missile sites, early warning stations
Air raid shelters, fall out shelters
Other types of hospitals, units connected with hospitals
Long stay hospitals, long stay units
Diagnosis facilities and radiology (X-ray diagnosis, radiotherapy)
Rehabilitation/physical medicine (physiotherapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, etc.)
Specialised hospital facilities by part of body
Health centres with minor surgery and accident and emergency facilities, day surgery health centres
Health centres without minor surgery and accident and emergency facilities
Maternity, ante natal and child clinics
Parts of primary health care facilities
Other animal living and rearing facilities
Restaurants, cafés, snack bars, coffee bars, tea shops
Discotheques/night clubs specialising in popular dance music
Leisure boxes, family entertainment venues, cinemas
Village halls, general purpose community halls
Slides, flumes, diving boards, wave generation, etc.
Other swimming pool and related facilities
Leisure centres with a sports hall, swimming pool and other sports facilities
Leisure centres with a sports hall and other sports facilities
Leisure centres without a sports hall
Sports grounds, small-scale spectator sport facilities, playing fields
Sports facilities by type of sport
Facilities/areas for the playing of the sport itself
Amusement facilities with computer controlled special effects
Field study centres, outdoor activity centres
Side chapels, baptisteries, confessing facilities, preaching facilities, sacramental facilities
Other parts of Christian worship facilities, churches
Tombs, mausoleums, funeral vaults, shrines, reliquaries
Schools for children with learning difficulties, mental handicaps, autism, emotional problems
Schools for children with physical handicaps
Polytechnics, technical colleges, general colleges of further education
General purpose teaching rooms other than lecture theatres
Other parts of further education facilities
Art galleries, facilities for the display of art
Centres for special kinds of exhibitions
Information facilities by form of material
Small groups of houses, single streets of houses
Speculative housing, housing for unspecified owner
General purpose storage facilities, cloakrooms, luggage rooms, stock rooms, waste storage facilities

Rule.Name: E - Construction entities
Rule.Description:
Classifies construction entities according to physical form/basic function, as opposed to user activity which is covered by the D - Facilities table.
'Apply' creates a Classification Reference for selected IFC entity, using Uniclass-required attributes derived from the item that you choose in the following list.

DataEntry.title: Concrete girder bridges with no pre-stressing
Bridges by geometry/scale, other types of bridges
Buildings defined by height/number of storeys
Buildings defined by relationship with adjacent buildings
Buildings constructed over something, air rights buildings
Buildings defined by special form of construction
Buildings with cable tensioned fabric roofs

Rule.Name: F - Spaces
Rule.Description:
Classifies spaces according to a number of different characteristics including their location, scale, and degree of enclosure, but not according to user activity (D - Facilities).
'Apply' creates a Classification Reference for selected IFC entity, using Uniclass-required attributes derived from the item that you choose in the following list.

DataEntry.title: Semi-independent parts of a building, blocks
Horizontally divided parts of buildings, storeys
First floor and above, but below highest floor
Space beneath a sloping roof, attic
Space on top of a flat roof
Building spaces by degree and type of enclosure
Building space analysed according to ISO 9836:1992
Building space analysed according to RICS and ISVA Code of measuring practice

Rule.Name: G - Elements for buildings
Rule.Description:
Classifies major physical parts of buildings and can be used for organising both design and cost information.
'Apply' creates a Classification Reference for selected IFC entity, using Uniclass-required attributes derived from the item that you choose in the following list.

DataEntry.title: Safety cabinet and fume cupboard extract systems
Laboratory and industrial waste disposal systems
Soakaways, septic tanks and sewage treatment plant
External works fencing and walling and hedges

Rule.Name: H - Elements for civil engineering works
Rule.Description:
Classifies construction entities (with the exception of buildings and construction complexes) according to physical form/basic function. For each type of construction entity the table classifies the major functional parts.
'Apply' creates a Classification Reference for selected IFC entity, using Uniclass-required attributes derived from the item that you choose in the following list.

DataEntry.title: Planting/surfacing to major soft landscaping construction entities
Minor landscaping/planting associated with roads, railways, etc.
Casing/outer lining of pipes, ducts, cables and channels
Pumps, other mechanical devices assisting the transportation/control of fluids and gases
Transformers, other electrical devices for transportation/control of electricity and electrical sign

IfcRelAssociatesClassification.Name: Uniclass - H - Elements for civil engineering works

Rule.Name: J - Work sections for buildings
Rule.Description:
Use this table for organising information in specifications and bills of quantities and for classifying information on particular types of construction operation.
'Apply' creates a Classification Reference for selected IFC entity, using Uniclass-required attributes derived from the item that you choose in the following list.

Work by others or subject to instruction

General specification for building services work

Accessories cast into in situ concrete

Proprietary roof decking with asphalt finish
Proprietary roof decking with felt finish
Metal mesh lathing/Anchored reinforcement for plastered coatings
Intumescent coatings for fire protection of steelwork

Appropriate section title for each project
Appropriate section title for each project
Appropriate section title for each project
Sundry work in connection with engineering services

Soakaways, septic tanks and sewage treatment plant
Hot and cold water supply systems
Hot and cold water supply systems - domestic
Mechanical heating, cooling and refrigeration systems
Combined heat and power equipment systems
Domestic heating, cooling and refrigeration systems
Safety cabinet and fume cupboard extract systems
Self contained emergency and signage systems
Central battery emergency and signage systems

Communications, security, safety and protection systems
Water leak detection and alarm systems
Domestic communications, security, safety and protection
Goods distribution and mechanised warehousing systems

Mechanical services control and monitoring systems

IfcRelAssociatesClassification.Name: Uniclass - J - Work sections for buildings

Rule.Name: K - Work sections for civil engineering works
Rule.Description:
Use this table for organising information in specifications and bills of quantities and for classifying information on particular types of construction operation.
'Apply' creates a Classification Reference for selected IFC entity, using Uniclass-required attributes derived from the item that you choose in the following list.

IfcRelAssociatesClassification.Name: Uniclass - K - Work sections for civil engineering works

Rule.Name: L - Construction products
Rule.Description:
Use this table for classifying trade literature and design/technical information relating to construction products.
'Apply' creates a Classification Reference for selected IFC entity, using Uniclass-required attributes derived from the item that you choose in the following list.

DataEntry.title: Other road control and monitoring products
Public health and environmental engineering products

Complete supply and distribution sets for gases

Equipment for laboratories, medical use, etc.

Electric power and lighting services products
Engine driven generating sets (gas or liquid fuel)

General display furniture/fittings, signs in general

Rule.Name: M - Construction aids
Rule.Description:
Use this table for classifying trade literature and technical information relating to plant and equipment used for aiding construction operations.

Rule.Name: N - Properties and characteristics
Rule.Description:
Use this table for classifying information on subjects related to properties and characteristics, for the arrangement of information in technical documents and for adding as a qualifier to codes from other tables.
'Apply' creates a Classification Reference for selected IFC entity, using Uniclass-required attributes derived from the item that you choose in the following list.

DataEntry.title: Overall strength/stability of structures; effects of/resistance to various types of loading
Strength of materials, components of structures
Other structural, mechanical properties and characteristics
Rate of heat release, fire load
Increasing fire resistance by means of a surface coating, encasement
Increasing fire resistance by changing choice of material
Increasing fire resistance by increasing thickness of elements
Fire safety, protection properties and characteristics (basic)
Internal fire spread (structure), fire compartmentation, fire barriers
Access and facilities for the fire service

Extinguishing fire with sprinkler systems, fire extinguishers
Other fire, explosion properties and characteristics
Properties and characteristics of air, gases
Permeability to gas, permeability to pollutants
Interactions between water vapour and solids
Interactions between liquid water and solids
Interactions between the weather/ground conditions and solids
Resistance to penetration of driving rain and snow
Wastes, pollution, harmful effects of matter
Effectiveness in disposal of liquid waste
Thermal conductance (C value), thermal conductivity (k value)
Thermal resistance (R value), thermal resistivity (r value)
Protection against airborne noise from outside
Protection against noise from another internal space

Other electric, magnetic, electromagnetic properties and characteristics
Re-use, change in use, adaptability, flexibility
Mis-use, wrong use, mistakes in use
People according to economic status, other status
Physical and mental properties and characteristics
Safety and security properties and characteristics
Other physical and mental properties and characteristics

Rule.Name: P - Materials
Rule.Description:
Use this table for classifying different kinds of material, and also for adding as a qualifier to codes from other tables, especially the construction products table.
'Apply' creates a Classification Reference for selected IFC entity, using Uniclass-required attributes derived from the item that you choose in the following list.

DataEntry.title: Animal and vegetable materials, excluding timber

Rule.Name: Q - Universal Decimal Classification
Rule.Description:
Use this table for classifying subjects not covered elsewhere in the Uniclass system.
'Apply' creates a Classification Reference for selected IFC entity, using Uniclass-required attributes derived from the item that you choose in the following list.

DataEntry.title: Organisations and other types of cooperation. Associations. Congresses. Exhibitions. Museums
Philosophy of mind and spirit. Metaphysics of spiritual life
Philosophical systems and points of view
Logic. Epistemology. Theory of knowledge. Methodology of logic
Natural theology. Rational theology. Religious philosophy
